definition: to transition to a new dynasty or regime
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Change each dinasty, the personalities of every lord are never changed.
sentences.chinese: 改朝換代，各個君主的個性依然如舊。

sentences.english: Bullets change governments far surer than votes.
sentences.chinese: 改朝換代槍桿子可比選票可靠得多。

sentences.english: Then, it is replaced by another dynasty repeating the same cycle.
sentences.chinese: 改朝換代後，另一個王朝又重複這樣的週期。

definition: fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
